techmeme.title: A study of 14K web domains in the C4, RefinedWeb, and Dolma AI training datasets: 5% of all the data, and 25% of the highest-quality data, has been restricted (Kevin Roose/New York Times)
A workaround to fix the BSOD caused by CrowdStrike's faulty update involves booting Windows in Safe Mode and deleting the security firm's "C-00000291*.sys" file (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Messari CEO Ryan Selkis says he's stepping down after a series of controversial political X posts, and Chief Revenue Officer Eric Turner will become interim CEO (Brady Dale/Axios)
The outage appears to have been caused by CrowdStrike pushing a faulty update to its Falcon software that causes Windows machines to get stuck in a boot loop (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Samsung says it has "temporarily" stopped deliveries of Galaxy Buds 3 Pro to retailers after some early owners reported quality control issues with the ear tips (Hadlee Simons/Android Authority)
